front.title: Service Discovery in the Homenet Environment with Multiple Connections

abstract.t: This document analyzes the problems of service discovery in a homenet multiple connection environment. A multiple connection environment consists of multiple-interfaced nodes connecting to multiple networks or multiple provisioning domains. Given a type of service a multiple-interfaced client is looking for, the discovery progress ought to return a correct pointer to the service instance that the client is able to access without trying every available channel.
